docs.snippet: Kiner was a character, a bon vivant, and not an overly polished announcer. His postgame show was required viewing, even if it looked like public access programming....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kiner was a character, a bon vivant, and not an overly polished announcer. His postgame show was required viewing, even if it looked like public access programming.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir tribute to Ralph Kiner, baseball broadcaster who died on Feb 6; holds Kiner's lack of pretension, his wit and his amiability made postgame show Kiner’s Korner required viewing, even if it looked like public access programming.

headline.main: Malaprops Were Part of the Charm of Kiner, an Enduring Met
headline.print_headline: Malaprops Were Part of the Charm of an Enduring Met

docs.snippet: Kiner led the National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half a century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kiner led the National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half a century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975.
docs.abstract: Ralph Kiner, baseball's vastly undersung slugger whose achievements in the batter's box were obscured by his decades in the broadcast booth, dies at age 91; led National League in home runs every year from 1946 to 1952, spent half century broadcasting Mets games and was inducted into Baseball Hall of Fame in 1975.

headline.main: Ralph Kiner, Slugger Who Became a Voice of the Mets, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Ralph Kiner, Hall of Fame Slugger and Longtime Mets Voice, Dies at 91

docs.snippet: Broadway's newest sports-based play, "Bronx Bombers," opened to mixed reviews on Friday, with some critics praising the casting of the New York Yankees drama and others wondering if it will hit any home runs beyond the hometown fans....

docs.snippet: Alex Rodriguez ended his extended and acrimonious fight with Major League Baseball on Friday, withdrawing a pair of lawsuits and accepting a season-long suspension that marks the longest penalty in the sport's history related to performance-enhanc...
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez ended his extended and acrimonious fight with Major League Baseball on Friday, withdrawing a pair of lawsuits and accepting a season-long suspension that marks the longest penalty in the sport's history related to performance-enhancing drugs.
